title: Rain, winds pull AQI to ‘moderate’ for first time in over 3 months in Delhi
The rush to nowhere: Can we pause?
Inside Track: Getting in the Groove
Avalanche alert in Uttarakhand: Warning issued for high-altitude areas
description: Avalanche risks loom over the higher altitudes of Uttarakhand for the next 24 hours. Both locals and visitors are urged to steer clear of unnecessary journeys. There's a significant danger level 2 (Yellow) declared in various districts peaking over 2,800m, while Chamoli exceeds level 3 (Orange) above 3,000m.

title: 2-minute silence on January 30: How the tradition began
Happy Republic Day 2026: Top 50 wishes, messages, and quotes to share
description: India celebrates its 76th Republic Day on January 26, 2026, commemorating the adoption of its Constitution. The grand parade on Kartavya Path will highlight military strength, cultural diversity, and technological advancements, with a special focus on the 150th anniversary of 'Vande Mataram'. Dignitaries from the European Council and Commission will attend as chief guests.

title: ‘Gave full diagnosis with half symptoms’: Friends, ex-colleagues recall clinical brilliance of medicine legend Dr J S Guleria
80 rescuers, no saviour: Who let Noida techie Yuvraj Mehta drown?
description: A young software engineer drowned in a Noida trench despite a massive rescue operation involving multiple agencies. Officials and the victim's father decried the "institutional failure," citing a lack of training, equipment, and coordination among first responders and specialized units. The tragedy exposed critical gaps in India's emergency response mechanism.

title: Just 4 cases in 2025: At Uttarakhand’s Devprayag police station, time and crime move at a glacial pace
Amid ‘Dashazari sena’, Nitish sharpens 1 crore job pitch, winds up Samriddhi Yatra first leg
P Chidambaram writes: Heed favourite economist’s advice
Morning Digest: Trump threatens Canada with 100% tariff over possible deal with China; Election Commission uploads SIR ‘logical discrepancy’ list, and more
description: Here is a select list of stories to start the day

title: Wake up from hibernation and activate SIR war rooms, Abhishek tells Trinamool MPs
description: The TMC leader Abhishek Banerjee said the work relating to SIR will have to be done by party workers during the day and in the evening, a film highlighting the achievements of Mamata Banerjee’s government will be screened

title: 'There's a coach at home': SKY reveals how his wife helped him rediscover form
description: Suryakumar Yadav revealed how patience, time in the middle, and a social media break helped him regain form after a challenging period. He credited his wife's advice and a focus on match performance over net sessions for his improved confidence.  He also emphasized the importance of team wins beyond individual performances.

title: What we know about the man shot dead by federal agents in Minneapolis

Trump heaps praise on U.K. troops after furore over his comments on NATO troops avoiding Afghan front line
17-year-old succumbs week after being set on fire in Patna; acquaintance arrested
Deportation, and re-deportation? A family looks for 14 kin, from Odisha to Bengal to Bangladesh
Myanmar holds its last election round with the army already certain to keep control over government
description: Voting has begun in the final round of Myanmar’s general election, concluding a monthlong process

title: ‘Divine’ dog had neuro trouble, rescued by vets
description: A Bijnor dog, celebrated by locals for its almost spiritual ritual of circling a Hanuman statue, has found refuge after intervention from animal rights activists. The dog's unusual behavior was traced back to a neurological condition caused by a tick-borne disease. Thankfully, Bhairav, the canine in question, has since received urgent veterinary care and is on a path to recovery.

title: US winter storm leads to more than 100,000 power outages, thousands of flight cancellations
Is sooji ‘just a glorified version of maida’?
‘Focus on what we can control,’ says Canadian PM Carney after Donald Trump threatens 100% tariffs
'Blackmail cricket world': PCB chief Naqvi under fire over pullout remarks
description: Former India cricketer Atul Wassan slammed PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi’s remarks on possibly skipping the 2026 T20 World Cup, calling it “foolish bravado.” He said dragging politics into cricket hurts players, not administrators. Wassan felt Pakistan was backing Bangladesh for political mileage. His comments followed Naqvi’s criticism of the ICC after Bangladesh were replaced by Scotland for refusing to follow the tournament schedule.

title: What lies behind Trump’s Greenland moves? | Explained
description: Why does the U.S. want Greenland? What has been the U.S. President’s recent rhetoric on the Arctic territory? Is there a comedown of sorts on tariffs? On the security aspect, isn’t Greenland protected by NATO? What is Greenland rich in besides reserves of oil and natural gas?

title: Federal immigration officers have shot and killed a man in Minneapolis, sparking further protests

There’s path to take off 25% Russian oil tariffs: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent
From Akola to Shimla gaushala, youth missing since 2018 reunites with family
Can India eliminate malaria by 2030? | Explained
description: What does the National Framework for Malaria Elimination in India lay down? From 2015-2023, by what percentage has malaria cases reduced in India? What is the protocol for testing, treating and tracking the disease? What does the World Malaria Report 2025 state?

title: On Republic Day, a letter to Dr Ambedkar
The hope for peace to prevail
description: Amid the recent violence in neighbouring Bangladesh, Indian families who had migrated to Bihar’s north-eastern district of Kishanganj in the 1960s, are concerned about family members who decided to stay back. Amarnath Tewary tells the stories of the migrants, who speak about the struggles of displacement and loss, as they now navigate worry

title: Battle lines on the sands of the Marina
description: The move to reduce the number of vending units on the Marina to merely 300 from 1,417, as part of the requirements of the Blue Flag Certification, has set the vendors on the beach in quandary. “We only ask for vending zones as our livelihood depends on them,” they say. This report combs the sands for a solution to this emerging crisis

title: Book of cartoonist, journalist and playwright T.S. Sridhar released
description: Two scenes from Marina’s famous ‘Thanikudithanam’ were also enacted on the occasion

title: What is RBI nudging India to do at BRICS? | Explained
description: What are the pros and cons of using central bank digital currencies for cross-border payments?

title: ‘Left UP backward for decades’: Shah urges people to reject ‘dynastic parties’, ensure BJP victory in 2027 elections
'Bangladesh overplayed its hand': Former BCB secretary slams T20 World Cup pullout
description: Former Bangladesh Cricket Board official Suyed Ashraful Haque has slammed the nation's withdrawal from the T20 World Cup, deeming it an unnecessary and detrimental decision. He argued that linking participation to an IPL player's exclusion was misguided, as ICC events boast superior security. Haque warned this move jeopardizes Bangladesh cricket's progress, with Scotland now replacing them.

description: If nothing works, turn the camera on India

title: Despite financial headwinds, PSU discoms clear power dues faster than pvt utilities
TCS overhaul hits IT jobs but peers keep adding to payrolls
Ahmedabad flat horror: Congress MP Shaktisinh Gohil’s nephew shoots wife
description: A shooting initially deemed accidental in Bodakdev has been reclassified as murder. Police now believe Yashrajsinh Gohil, nephew of Congress MP Shaktisinh Gohil, intentionally shot his wife Rajeshwari before taking his own life. Forensic and ballistic evidence ruled out accidental discharge. The investigation revealed the fatal shot struck Rajeshwari at the base of her head.

title: US winter storm: Donald Trump approves emergency declarations across multiple states
description: President Trump approved emergency declarations for ten states facing severe winter storms, with federal agencies coordinating with state officials to ensure public safety.  The major storm brought heavy snow and dangerous ice across large parts of the country, impacting millions and causing widespread flight cancellations.

title: Daffodils and inheritance of English
description: The poem does more than reveal imperial anxiety; it produces something more insidious: desire

title: At CHIME reunion, celebration of a life-saving mission amid stories of courage

description: Education alone does not shatter it, as society still believes that men are inherently superior

description: They are two powerful weapons, and they are contagious too

title: Crowded with content
description: Endless scrolling is tiresome and every post asks for attention, agreement, reaction, validation

title: Grateful to ICC for T20 World Cup invite, preparing to arrive in India immediately: Cricket Scotland CEO
description: Scotland, however, will need some time to announce their 15-member squad for the tournament which begins on February 7.

title: Beat the clock and crack the exam
description: Exams ultimately reward preparedness and discipline — but above all, they reward those who learn to race the clock

title: Slaying the demons of the mind
description: Always remember whenever the nights feel endless, it’s okay to be not okay

title: Education must lend meaning to life
description: Pay attention to the hearts and minds of children; nurture a moral vision about the role of the self in family, society, nation, world

title: US federal immigration agents kill 2nd Minneapolis man, sparking protests
Silver lining: Woman lives 25 years with a donor heart
description: Preeti Unhale, 51, has become India's longest-living heart transplant survivor, marking 25 years with a donor heart on January 23, 2026.  Facing a critical condition in 2000, she underwent the life-saving procedure at AIIMS, demonstrating remarkable resilience and adherence to lifelong medical discipline.

title: Koraput district administrator in Odisha bans sale of non-vegetarian food on Republic Day
description: Prohibiting non-vegetarian food items on a national holiday is nothing but a directive influenced by ideology of Rastriya Swayamsevak Sangh, says Koraput Lok Sabha MP Saptagiri Sankar Ulaka

title: Josh Allen's $8.5M mansion move amid injury fears, Steinfeld era
description: Josh Allen, the Buffalo Bills’ star player, started the season with a lot of hopes, until it came crashing down as the Buffalo Bills lost brutally against the Denver Broncos in the divisional round. Though Josh Allen has a lot to look forward to this year as he and his wife, Hailee Steinfeld, are all set to become parents soon, he is also recovering from a brutal injury on his right foot. Amid all the mess, Josh Allen makes a shocking $8.5 million move which has raised eyebrows.

title: Ailing wife in rickshaw van, 70-yr-old in Odisha cycles 600km to hospital & back
description: A 70-year-old man, Babu Lohar, pedalled his rickshaw van 300km to Cuttack with his ailing wife for medical treatment, refusing help. After two months, he is now making the arduous journey back home, showcasing immense devotion and highlighting the struggles of the poor in accessing healthcare and transport.

title: NBA postpones Warriors-Timberwolves over Minneapolis shooting
description: A fatal shooting involving federal agents in Minneapolis has led to the postponement of the Golden State Warriors vs. Minnesota Timberwolves game. The incident, which occurred Saturday morning, prompted the NBA's decision to reschedule the match for Sunday. This marks the third such encounter with federal officers in Minnesota this month.

title: Get rid of issues you faced in govt offices, PM Modi tells 61k recruits
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi urged over 61,000 newly-recruited personnel to recall their past difficulties with government offices and ensure citizens do not face similar issues. He emphasized their role in implementing reforms and upholding the motto 'Citizen is akin to God' to strengthen ease of living and doing business.

title: 'Let ICE do their job': Trump reacts after federal agents fatally shoot Alex Pretti in Minnesota
Eight held for ‘digital arrest’ of city couple, duping them of ₹14 crore
description: Cambodia-based conspirators impersonated police officers, forced couple to share banking details, says DCP (IF&SO); those arrested include a priest

title: Snow brings pain in Himachal Pradesh: Roads closed, no power & water supply; tourists stranded
description: Himachal Pradesh grapples with severe disruption as heavy snowfall paralyzes transport, power, and water supply across multiple districts. Lahaul and Spiti remains cut off, with hundreds of tourists stranded in Manali. Authorities are working on a war footing to clear roads and restore essential services amidst freezing temperatures and significant snowfall in popular tourist spots.

title: India votes against UN resolution censuring Iran
description: India voted against a UN Human Rights Council resolution condemning Iran's protest crackdown, extending a fact-finding mission. This move, aligning with China and Pakistan, signals India's commitment to non-interference and its strategic interests, particularly concerning the Chabahar port. Iran's envoy lauded India's 'principled and firm support' against what he termed an 'unjust' resolution.

title: Pax Silica | The silicon curtain
description: By formalising a coalition that includes Australia’s mines to Singapore’s logistics and Japan’s precision machinery, the U.S. is attempting to build a ‘closed-loop’ ecosystem

title: ‘Reason gives way’: victims describe trauma of ‘digital arrest’
Supreme Court judge slams collegium for transfer on government nudge
description: Supreme Court Justice Ujjal Bhuyan voiced strong dissent over the collegium's decision to transfer Justice Atul Sreedharan, citing executive influence. He argued that such transfers, especially when prompted by the central government, compromise judicial independence and the integrity of the collegium system. Justice Bhuyan emphasized the judiciary's reliance on public faith.

title: Three NDMC halls to be used as night shelters till March 15
Labour party joins electoral alliance led by Jamaat-e-Islami in Bangladesh
description: Islami Andolan Bangladesh’s top leader Gazi Ataur Rahman had claimed that the party quit the alliance after being “deprived of justice” regarding seat allocations

title: Board of Peace | The chairman’s circle
description: Donald Trump says the board he proposed to oversee the reconstruction of war-devastated Gaza could become ‘one of the most consequential bodies ever created’, but a majority of the countries invited have stayed away from the signing ceremony in Davos

title: Donald Trump praises ‘brave’ British soldiers; remarks follow row over Nato, Afghanistan
description: Donald Trump lauded British soldiers as "great and very brave warriors" in Afghanistan, a day after UK PM Keir Starmer condemned Trump's earlier remarks about NATO allies' frontline contributions as "insulting and appalling." Trump reiterated his skepticism about NATO's collective defense. Starmer paid tribute to the 457 British service personnel who died in Afghanistan, calling Trump's comments deeply hurtful.

title: Who was Alex Pretti? 37-year-old identified as man shot dead by federal officers in Minneapolis
description: In a tragic turn of events, 37-year-old Alex Jeffrey Pretti, a US citizen, was shot dead by federal immigration agents in Minneapolis. Officials confirmed that during a large immigration enforcement operation, Pretti brandished a weapon and resisted arrest, prompting a Border Patrol agent to open fire in self-defense.

title: Farmers rue decrease in coconut price in open market
Fans urge Travis Kelce to apologize to Justin Baldoni amid backlash
description: Travis Kelce's Instagram comments are buzzing with criticism, not football talk. A viral plea for him to apologize to 'Justin' on his podcast has ignited widespread demand for accountability. Notably, some Swifties are joining the chorus, questioning the situation's handling, a shift that amplifies the online discourse and Kelce's continued silence.

title: Jens-Frederik Nielsen | In the eye of the storm
description: Greenland’s PM has to walk a tightrope between rejecting Trump’s imperial overtures and accommodating American investments and security presence while navigating domestic politics

Palaniswami flays Stalin over bombs being thrown on police vehicle near Perambalur
description: He says the law and order situation in the State has become “a laughing stock”

title: Goa: Police debunk Russian man's claim of killing 19 women; 2 murders confirmed
description: A Russian national arrested for two murders in Goa claimed to have killed 19 women across India. Police investigations revealed most of these claims were unsubstantiated, with only two confirmed murders linked to the accused. Authorities are continuing to verify the remaining allegations.

title: Centre of Advanced Neurotechnology launched at CMC in Ranipet
Bangladesh polls see 80 minority candidates; parties, independents in the fray
description: A significant 80 candidates from religious and ethnic minority groups are vying for seats in Bangladesh's upcoming national election, with 12 running independently.  While the ruling Awami League is absent, 22 parties, including BNP and Jamaat-e-Islami, have put forward 68 minority candidates.  Notably, Jamaat-e-Islami has nominated its first-ever minority candidate.

title: Six held for kidnapping 13-month-old baby
U.S. envoys Kushner, Witkoff in Israel for talks on Gaza: U.S. official
description: Israeli media reported that the talks would also focus on the return of the remains of the last Israeli hostage still held in Gaza.

title: More infrastructure works planned at Island Grounds temporary bus terminus
description: The current facilities at the Island Grounds terminal include concrete benches, separate toilets for men, women, persons with disabilities, and transpersons, drinking water kiosks, staff dining areas, police rooms, and ticket counters

Women employees entitled to maternity leave for third pregnancy too, reiterates Madras High Court
description: Justices R. Suresh Kumar and Shamim Ahmed direct Chief Secretary to circular their order to all HoDs so that they do not deny such benefit in future

title: Assam SIR: Opposition flags 'misuse' of Form-7; CM says notices sent only to ‘miyas’
description: Assam's electoral roll revision has sparked a political storm, with opposition parties accusing the government of misusing Form-7 to harass genuine voters, particularly targeting "miya" Muslims. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma defended the process, stating notices are aimed at alleged illegal immigrants to keep them under pressure, while the election department assures a legal process for all objections.

title: DMDK will be part of alliance that will form the next government: Premallatha
description: She says the DMDK is the only political party in Tamil Nadu without any cases related to corruption or accumulation of disproportionate assets

title: Tata Steel Chess: Gukesh loses 2nd game in row; Arjun Erigaisi loses too while Praggnanandhaa’s winless streak continues
J&K: Jailed MP Engineer Rashid gets interim bail to attend budget session in custody
description: A Delhi court granted interim bail to J&K MP Sheikh Abdul Rashid, allowing him to attend Parliament's budget session under armed escort.  Rashid, jailed since 2019 on UAPA charges, recently defeated Omar Abdullah in the Lok Sabha polls.  This limited relief permits him to participate in parliamentary proceedings while remaining in custody, a move welcomed by his party.

title: MNM forms five-member election committee for Assembly poll
description: Recently, the Election Commission allotted ‘Battery Torch’ as the symbol for the party

title: Chief Minister Stalin opposes NEET for allied and health care courses
description: In a letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, he says the National Commission for Allied and Health Care Professions has made a ‘hasty and ad hoc decision’ with ‘multiple deleterious consequences’

title: Why it is time to audit India’s National Health Policy 2017
description: The National Health Policy 2017 set a clear direction and measurable milestones. By 2026, India had advanced on several fronts, missed others, and encountered risks that were not fully imagined in 2017. The lesson is that programmes, financing, and measurement must move together

title: The HPV vaccine is not a free pass: why regular pap smears still matter
description: The HPV vaccine does not replace Pap smears. Vaccination and screening must go hand in hand. The HPV vaccine protects against the most common high-risk strains of the virus that cause cervical cancer, but this means there remains a small but significant risk of cervical cell changes even after vaccination

Palash Muchhal files defamation case against producer who alleged he cheated on Smriti Mandhana
description: Music composer Palash Muchhal has filed a ₹10 crore defamation case against Sangli-based producer Vidnyan Mane. Mane had accused Muchhal of duping him of ₹40 lakh in a film project and also alleged he cheated on cricketer Smriti Mandhana. Mane claimed Muchhal promised profits and a role in his film 'Nazaria', but the project was never completed.

title: Lifelong learning key to success, students told
Delhi Capitals hand RCB first loss, boost WPL playoff hopes
description: Delhi Capitals secured a crucial seven-wicket win against Royal Challengers Bengaluru, handing the league leaders their first WPL defeat. After restricting RCB to 109, Delhi's chase was anchored by Laura Wolvaardt's unbeaten 42 and Jemimah Rodrigues' 24, ensuring a comfortable victory with 26 balls to spare. Nandani Sharma starred with the ball for Delhi.

title: Man shot during Minneapolis immigration crackdown has died, National Guard activated
description: Department of Homeland Security spokesperson Tricia McLaughlin said that the person had a firearm with two magazines and that the situation was “evolving.”

title: Migrant worker from Beldanga ‘died by suicide’ in Jharkhand, says West Bengal Police
description: Violence erupted at Beldanga in Murshidabad on January 16 over the death of 30-year-old migrant worker Alauddin Sheikh; a large number of people took to the streets by blocking railway tracks and national highway for several hours

description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the U.S. may consider lifting the additional 25% tariff on India linked to Russian oil purchases, noting that India’s refinery imports of Russian crude have sharply declined.

Crazy scenes! Hours after Scotland replace Bangladesh at T20 World Cup, BCB director quits
description: Bangladesh cricket faced fresh turmoil as BCB director Ishtiaque Sadeque resigned on the same day the ICC replaced Bangladesh with Scotland for the 2026 T20 World Cup. Sadeque cited family and personal reasons, denying any internal disputes. The ICC removed Bangladesh after it refused to play in India over security concerns. Scotland were named as the replacement based on ICC rankings.

description: At Davos, Donald Trump declared himself ruler, threatening economic warfare for Greenland and mocking allies. He later softened his stance, claiming a deal was formed, while also launching a new 'Board of Peace' potentially overshadowing the UN. Trump also marked his second term anniversary with a victory lap and hints at a fourth term.

Skipper Ayush Mhatre starred with a rapid 27-ball 53 as India topped Group B.

The announcement was made on Saturday, bringing clarity to weeks of uncertainty over Bangladesh’s participation in the tournament.

Google CEO Sundar Pichai sells shares worth $10.6 million, now owns …
description: Google CEO Sundar Pichai sold over 30,000 Alphabet Class C shares for approximately $10.6 million on January 21, 2026. This transaction occurred under a pre-established Rule 10b5-1 trading plan. The sale follows a strong year for Google stock, driven by AI advancements and a significant market valuation.

Reggie Miller urges Stephen Curry to call Giannis as father time knocks
description: Reggie Miller urged Stephen Curry to recruit Giannis Antetokounmpo to the Warriors, citing Milwaukee's struggles and the Warriors' need for star power after Jimmy Butler's injury. Miller believes this blockbuster move could save Curry's prime and reshape the league, combining two of the game's biggest stars for a championship push.

title: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet urges hands-on learning; cites 300 leaders trained
description: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet stresses that leaders must grasp AI to guide their companies through transformation. She advocates for leader-led training, citing a client whose 300 leaders had to directly use AI tools before progress was made. This hands-on approach, starting with top executives, is crucial for unlocking AI's potential and ensuring widespread adoption across all sectors.

title: Buffalo Bills fans rally to bring back ex-coach Sean McDermott after firing
description: A passionate Buffalo Bills fan, Maria Maisonet, created a Change.org petition to reinstate head coach Sean McDermott, accumulating over 45,000 signatures. The fan believes McDermott’s dismissal is short-sighted, overlooking his contributions and player respect. She argues McDermott deserves a chance to coach in the new stadium [New Highmark Stadium]. Bills owner Terry Pegula sensed something in the locker room, which led to McDermott’s firing.

title: Netflix rejects Paramount’s offer, says nothing else other than Oracle’s backing
description: Netflix co-CEO Greg Peters dismissed Paramount Skydance's $108 billion bid for Warner Bros. Discovery as unrealistic, citing its heavy reliance on debt. He contrasted it with Netflix's more stable $82.7 billion all-cash offer, which is gaining traction with shareholders.  The potential merger faces significant Hollywood and regulatory scrutiny.

title: Amazon layoffs 'announced'; company set to cut thousands of jobs
description: Amazon is planning to cut approximately 14,000 corporate jobs starting next week, marking the second major layoff wave since October and bringing total reductions to 30,000 roles. CEO Andy Jassy clarified the cuts aren't driven by AI or financial concerns but by excessive bureaucracy and organizational layers. The layoffs will affect employees across AWS, retail, Prime Video, and human resources divisions, representing nearly 10% of Amazon's corporate workforce.
